meanings.definition: An abundance or large quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with a profusion of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: There was a profusion of books on the shelves of the library.
meanings.sent3: The profusion of snacks at the party made everyone's eyes light up.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room with a profusion of joy.
meanings.sent5: The profusion of stars in the night sky took my breath away.

meanings.sent1: The ballroom was decorated with a profusion of sparkling lights.
meanings.sent2: The fashion show featured a profusion of elegant gowns.
meanings.sent3: The profusion of balloons at the event created a whimsical atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a profusion of colors and shapes, mesmerizing all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The profusion of applause after the performance was deafening.
